lines.text: Are you a taxi?
No.
[pointing at the vehicle]
*This* is a taxi.
[pointing at himself]
*I'm* a driver.
[pointing at Pintpot]
*He's* a learner.
[pointing at the expectant father]
And *you're* a twit. Now get out of the way, I'm in a hurry.
No, no, you must help me. It's my wife - she's going to have a baby.
And if I don't get home by seven, mine's gonna have a fit.
[after Charlie gives her a fur coat]
Oh, Charlie! Oh, it's lovely!
I'll say it is. Genuine mammoth, that is.
Oh, don't be silly, Charlie.
"Mammoth fur sale."
Are you the boss or something?
I'm what they call the something manager. My advice to you is to be off.
You mean buzz off?
No, but you're getting warm!
Suppose we have a man passenger and he tries to "start something"?
Then use this.
[Flo holds up a starting handle]
What's that?
A starting handle - and there's nothing better for stopping something.

When you get to be a cab driver you cut yourself right off from the rest of the human race. Everybody's got it in for you and nobody loves you. In no time at all you find that you're about as popular as a wickerwork seat in a nudist camp, and you know what sort of impression that makes on people.
[Charlie goes to the Glamcabs office and discovers who "Mrs Glam" really is]
You! So that's it. Gor blimey. What a mug I've been.
Charlie, please, I know what you're thinking.
Good, then it saves telling you, Mrs Glam!

[to the car salesman]
We'll take fifteen!
[Charlie, not knowing that Peggy is running Glamcabs, tells her all about the planned sabotage]
What you're going to do is wrong, Charlie!
All right, so it's wrong, Charlie! And I'm a right Charlie!
[last line - Pintpot has made Charlie swerve and hit a tree. His taxi is undriveable]
Call me a cab!
